pullRequest.body:
The statements of stability follow those used for `mergeSort` in leanprover/lean4#5092.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This PR is a result of [this discussion on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/Insertion.20Sort/near/464335927), where @semorrison recommended we verify that `List.insertionSort` is stable.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [cbd44d5495](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16065/commits/cbd44d5495a27b94b0215d22b140aa5afbc5d23f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Sublist.orderedInsert_sublist`
`+ cons_sublist_orderedInsert`
`+ pair_sublist_insertionSort`
`+ pair_sublist_insertionSort'`
`+ sublist_insertionSort`
`+ sublist_insertionSort'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Otherwise LGTM!
I've added the stability theorems based on `<+~`, as well as the additional lemma `orderedInsert_sublist`.

Also, https://github.com/leanprover/lean4-nightly/commit/6d0b00885ed79c0910080613f33e1189bb496ce8 adds `Pairwise.erase`, which I would use on Line 425. Should I add a TODO indicating that this should be changed once Mathlib uses the next release, or is this not important enough?
I've changed the theorem names as to align with https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/5242
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11091284646/job/30814807309)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11091284646/job/30814807471)
And please add the TODO, yes
Can you try to minimize the use of `case`? Thanks.
Sure :) Out of interest, what is the reasoning behind this?
It is just stylistic for the library. If you have to use `case`, then that is an indication that the tactic's syntax needs to be extended.

Here's a shorter proof
```suggestion
theorem orderedInsert_stable {l c : List α} (a : α) (hl : c <+ l) : c <+ orderedInsert r a :=
  hl.trans <| sublist_orderedInsert a l
```
which maybe suggests you don't need this lemma at all!
This only needs the weaker `c <+~ l`, right?

I have a proof based on `<+~` which relies on a lemma I don't know how to prove, yet:

```lean
theorem orderedInsert_sublist {as bs} (a) (hs : as <+ bs) (hb : bs.Sorted r) :
    orderedInsert r a as <+ orderedInsert r a bs := 
  sorry

variable [DecidableEq α] [IsAntisymm α r] [IsTotal α r] [IsTrans α r]

/--
A version of `insertionSort_stable` which only assumes `c <+~ l` (instead of `c <+ l`), but
additionally requires `DecidableEq α`, `IsAntisymm α r`, `IsTotal α r` and `IsTrans α r`.
-/
theorem insertionSort_stable' {l c : List α} (hs : c.Sorted r) (hc : c <+~ l) :
    c <+ insertionSort r l := by
  obtain ⟨d, hc, hd⟩ := hc
  induction l generalizing c d with
  | nil         => simp_all only [sublist_nil, insertionSort, nil_perm]
  | cons a _ ih =>
    cases hd
    · exact ih ‹_› _ ‹_› ‹_› |>.trans (sublist_orderedInsert ..)
    · have := hs.sublist <| erase_sublist a _
      have := hc.mem_iff.mp <| mem_cons_self ..
      have := erase_cons_head a _ ▸ hc.erase _
      specialize ih ‹_› _ ‹_› ‹_›
      exact orderedInsert_erase _ _ ‹_› ‹_› ▸ orderedInsert_sublist _ ih (sorted_insertionSort ..)
```

Unfortunately, the proof of the stability theorem then requires `[DecidableEq α] [IsAntisymm α r] [IsTotal α r] [IsTrans α r]`. Not sure if this is fundamentally necessary, or only due to my particular proof? If it's necessary, then perhaps it would be good to also keep the `<+` version of the theorem.

> If it's necessary, then perhaps it would be good to also keep the <+ version of the theorem.

Agreed.
You're using `‹_›` a lot, which isn't great for readability. I'd suggest switching to `cases ... with` and `split_ifs`, if that helps, and otherwise at least fill in the underscores.
Fixed

No need for `DecidableEq`

```suggestion
variable [IsAntisymm α r] [IsTotal α r] [IsTrans α r]

/--
A version of `insertionSort_stable` which only assumes `c <+~ l` (instead of `c <+ l`), but
additionally requires `IsAntisymm α r`, `IsTotal α r` and `IsTrans α r`.
-/
theorem insertionSort_stable' {l c : List α} (hs : c.Sorted r) (hc : c <+~ l) :
    c <+ insertionSort r l := by
  classical
  obtain ⟨d, hc, hd⟩ := hc
```

I think this should be called
```suggestion
theorem Sublist.orderedInsert_sublist [IsTrans α r] {as bs} (x) (hs : as <+ bs) (hb : bs.Sorted r) :
```
or
```suggestion
theorem sublist_orderedInsert_of_sublist [IsTrans α r] {as bs} (x) (hs : as <+ bs) (hb : bs.Sorted r) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: stability of `List.insertionSort`
